ratings.question_text: Overall, how would you rate the workload of this course in comparison to other Yale courses you have taken?
What is your overall assessment of this course?
Do you expect to use this class for credit toward your major, or toward a pre-professional program?

narratives.question_text: How would you summarize ECON 110 05 for a fellow student? Would you recommend ECON 110 05 to another student? Why or why not?
comments: Great way to spend your Friday afternoons. Take it.

I would, but not if you expect to do a lot of painting. If you'd like a fairly technical art historical class in which you apply some of the techniques you've learned about, take it. I learned a lot, but I did not paint a lot. The painting you do is mostly self-motivated. There are three practice paintings and a final painting, but the bulk of the assignments are either in presentation or written form. Mark has high expectations for these. Overall, the course is really interesting and you learn a fairly wide breadth of techniques. I look at paintings differently now that I know something about how they were made and subsequently restored.
Great class, relaxed and interesting! Grading hard

TAKE THIS CLASS - I learned a lot that I never would have learned in a traditional studio course. It provided me with a new perspective on the craft of painting and will certainly impact the way I view art in the future.

Yes! Even if you've never painted before, you'll still enjoy the class. You learn a lot about the old painting masters and different techniques. You'll never be able to look at paintings in a museum the same way again.
Yes. This is an awesome class different than any class you will take art or otherwise.
